{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3533673,"name":"Emmanuel Perez","username":"Emma4735","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emma4735/{size}/216176_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:37:36.961Z","cooked":"

Hey, my question is quite easy, we plan to use 14 neos for our final robot design, all of them connected with CAN, and we hace 0 canivore. Last season we had some problems with CAN reaching high levels with 13 motors and sometimes that reseted the robot, we don’t know if the problem is CAN, or it was just a battery problem? What are your hypothesis?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T00:37:36.961Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":355,"readers_count":354,"score":156.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492396,"topic_slug":"do-we-need-a-canivore","display_username":"Emmanuel Perez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61412,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/do-we-need-a-canivore/492396/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3533676,"name":"","username":"pigrammer","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/pigrammer/{size}/234083_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:41:01.361Z","cooked":"

You definitely don’t need a CANivore given that your SPARK MAX motor controllers (or Thrifty Novas for that matter) are not CAN FD-capable, only CAN 2.0, so a CANivore (which provides an extra CAN FD bus) will not work. 14 devices on the bus should be fine, I think; that’s about what we had last year and AFAIK we didn’t run into any bus utilization issues.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T00:41:27.266Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":353,"readers_count":352,"score":145.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492396,"topic_slug":"do-we-need-a-canivore","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64857,"hidden":false,"trust_level":3,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"246 Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-need-a-canivore/492396/2","custom_user_title":"246 Software Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533678,"name":"","username":"Swerve","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/swerve/{size}/210309_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T00:42:55.989Z","cooked":"

If your CAN bus reaches high levels then that would be incentive enough for me to get a CANivore. Last season we did not have a CANivore and the high CAN bus usage caused a lot of untraceable issues primarily in software (bad auto routines, weird command-following) that disappeared after we bought one for ourselves. I think anything above 90% CANbus usage is pushing it.

The CTRE CANivore only works with (newer) CTRE devices. It does not support NEOs unless you are controlling them with Talon FXS controllers.

Maybe it works for Sparks. You’d have to ask CTRE if this happened.
CAN FD – CTR Electronics*

  • CAN FD could potentially support older CAN 2.0 products by switching to a legacy CAN 2.0 mode. *

SLAB-Mr.Thomas:

Maybe it works for Sparks. You’d have to ask CTRE if this happened.
CAN FD – CTR Electronics *

There’s far more that would need to happen then just that. RevLib would also need to be updated to support the canivore.

codedocs.revrobotics.com

SignalsConfig (FRC-REVLib API)

declaration: package: com.revrobotics.spark.config, class: SignalsConfig

I believe you can use these configs to disable or reduce the update rate on signals you aren’t or seldom use.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T04:20:22.842Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":53.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":492396,"topic_slug":"do-we-need-a-canivore","display_username":"Eric Ward","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://codedocs.revrobotics.com/java/com/revrobotics/spark/config/signalsconfig","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SignalsConfig (FRC-REVLib API)","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":35208,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3637 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-need-a-canivore/492396/7","custom_user_title":"3637 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533953,"name":"Nick Foote","username":"Footie","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T05:59:44.203Z","cooked":"

It’s definitely possible to run all these on a single non-CANivore CAN loop You can’t actually use non CTRE motors with CANivore, and there is no Rev alternative. We’ve got 11 Vortex + 4 Neo 550s and we’re doing fine on CAN.

I’m not as in tune with our programing as our mechanical side (maybe @Paul_R can answer since he’s one of our programmers), but my understanding is that we used to have these issues in past years, and it was largely down to polling too frequently in our programming (especially for things that don’t really need to have super specific speeds or rotation counts on the encoders, like running an intake), and then we’d try to log more things to find out what was wrong, and that would make the CAN even more saturated, making the problem worse.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T05:59:44.203Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":38.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492396,"topic_slug":"do-we-need-a-canivore","display_username":"Nick Foote","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":8103,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-need-a-canivore/492396/8","custom_user_title":"Nick Foote - 2102 Team Paradox - Engineering Mentor and Founding Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533962,"name":"Paul Regnier","username":"Paul_R","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/paul_r/{size}/203827_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T06:22:13.255Z","cooked":"

We’ve primarily run into those kind of problems with the v1 roborio’s limited processing power and memory causing loop overruns, not the CAN loop, but it has occured with CAN a couple times. It’s not really something to panic about, but getting rid of old debugging and logging messages from ages ago also helps with making the ones you are using at the moment more accessible .

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T06:22:40.980Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":49.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492396,"topic_slug":"do-we-need-a-canivore","display_username":"Paul Regnier","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":8103,"username":"Footie","name":"Nick Foote","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/footie/{size}/218325_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61214,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2102 Lead Programmer and OA Lead"},"post_url":"/t/do-we-need-a-canivore/492396/9","custom_user_title":"2102 Lead Programmer and OA Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3534733,"name":"Pedro Braga","username":"predobrega","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/predobrega/{size}/211207_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T21:33:57.957Z","cooked":"

You should check on the DS for the CAN usage %.
If that ends up actually being too high, I would suggest you to take @Footie’s advice and reduce your data polling rates. 14 motors + 5-ish other devices should fit fairly well in the FRC CAN bandwidth.
